wipeCountdown.title: Expedition Project Ends:
wipeCountdown.description: Season 1 is coming to a close. Confirm your Expedition Project progress to save your Season 1 stats and prepare your ARCTracker account for Season 2.

HomePage.welcomeDescription: Your personal companion for tracking progress in ARC Raiders.
HomePage.privacyNoticeText: All your data is saved locally in your browser. You can backup and restore your progress anytime via the Settings page.
HomePage.communityNewsText: Please join our Discord and help us build out the ARC Raiders item and quest database. We're looking for high quality screenshots of items, quest data, and crafting recipe details.
HomePage.overlayPromoSubtitle: Access ARCTracker directly in-game with our overlay. Inspect items, track quests, and monitor your progress without leaving the game.
HomePage.lfgDescription: We've partnered with the ARC Raiders LFG Discord - the best place to find teammates for your raids. Join over 70.000 of raiders looking to squad up!

stashCta.title: Sync Your ARC Raiders Account
stashCta.description: Link your ARC Raiders game account to automatically sync your stash, workshops, quests, and projects. No more manual tracking.

MapEvents.tutorialStep1: Click the bell icon on any event to track it
MapEvents.tutorialStep2: When a tracked event starts, you'll see a notification at the top of the page
MapEvents.tutorialStep3: Enable sound alerts with the speaker icon in the header
MapEvents.tutorialStep4: Notifications work across all pages while you browse
MapEvents.tutorialStep5: Your tracked events are saved to your account

GuestBackupBanner.title: Your progress is stored locally
GuestBackupBanner.description: You're using ARC Tracker as a guest. Your data is only saved in this browser. Download a backup to keep your progress safe, or create an account to sync across devices.

SettingsPage.restoreDialogDescription: This will replace all your current data with the data from the backup file. Your current progress will be overwritten. Make sure you have a backup of your current data if you want to keep it.

Metadata.safeToRecycleTitle: Safe to Recycle - ARC Raiders Guide | ARCTracker.io

OverlayPage.heroSubtitle: Take the guesswork out of looting in ARC Raiders. Inspect items in-game, view interactive maps, and track your progress all without leaving the game.
OverlayPage.featureInspectDescription: Press your inspect hotkey (default Ctrl+F) and ARCTracker reads the item tooltip on your screen and finds it in our database.
OverlayPage.featureTooltipsDescription: See what each item is needed for, and why it matters – so you can decide whether to keep, sell, or recycle.
OverlayPage.featureTrackingDescription: Mark your hideout, quest, and project progress. Tooltips keep you up to date on what you can safely sell or recycle.
OverlayPage.featureMapsDescription: Plan farming routes, find key locations, and optimize how you spend your time in each raid.
OverlayPage.featureDatabaseDescription: Browse a curated item database to understand where things come from, what they're used for, and how to craft them.
OverlayPage.featureSkillTreeDescription: Theorycraft your builds so you know exactly where you're heading before you spend a skill point.
OverlayPage.featureOverlayDescription: The tooltip appears near your cursor when you inspect an item and automatically hides itself based on your actions.
OverlayPage.featureSecondScreenDescription: Prefer a clean HUD? ARCTracker can run on a secondary monitor as a companion app.
OverlayPage.screenshotsSubtitle: Click any screenshot to view it larger
OverlayPage.screenshotInspectCaption: Instant item insight with usage-focused tooltips right in your inventory
OverlayPage.screenshotMapCaption: Interactive maps with loot locations, extractions, and points of interest
OverlayPage.screenshotCheatsheetCaption: Needed items cheatsheet to track your progression requirements
OverlayPage.screenshotHomeCaption: Track your overall progress across quests, hideout, and needed items
OverlayPage.whyDescription: ARC Raiders loot can be complex, and it's easy to accidentally recycle something that becomes important later. ARCTracker gives you clear, fast information in real time, plus planning tools between sessions, so you can make smart decisions without alt-tabbing to wikis or spreadsheets.
OverlayPage.ctaText: Install ARCTracker, jump into ARC Raiders, and turn every looted item into an informed choice.
OverlayPage.faqBanQuestion: Can I get banned for using ARCTracker?
OverlayPage.faqBanAnswer: Embark has not directly endorsed ARC Tracker, but their official FAQ states that overlays are allowed as long as they don't interfere with gameplay or offer an unfair advantage. The app is screenshot-based only — it doesn't read game memory, modify game files, or interact with the game in any way. Displaying item information is no different than alt-tabbing to check a wiki — we just make it faster.
OverlayPage.faqHowAnswer: When you press the inspect hotkey, ARC Tracker takes a screenshot of the item tooltip and reads the item name. It matches it against our database and displays the relevant info in an overlay. That's it. No memory reading, no file injection, no game modification — just a screenshot and a database lookup.
OverlayPage.faqTroubleshootQuestion: The overlay isn't working. What should I do?
OverlayPage.faqTroubleshootAnswer: Please try restarting Overwolf first. If that doesn't resolve the issue, reach out to us for assistance in

DiscordBotPage.featureRaidHistoryDescription: Automatically post your raid summaries to a Discord channel. Show off your loot, track your progress, and share your runs with your squad.
DiscordBotPage.featureEventTimersDescription: Get real-time updates on ongoing and upcoming map events. Never miss a harvester, night raid, or other special event again.
DiscordBotPage.linkCodeDescription: Generate a one-time code to link your ARC Tracker account to a Discord server.
DiscordBotPage.signInRequired: Sign in to generate a link code
DiscordBotPage.noCodeYet: No link code generated yet. Generate one to link your account to a Discord server.
DiscordBotPage.codeInstructions: Run /addraider with this code in your Discord server, or give it to your server owner to link your raids.
DiscordBotPage.codeOneTimeUse: This code can only be used once.

marketing.heroSubtitle: Bring ARC Raiders tracking directly to your Discord server. Share raid reports, track map events, and keep your squad informed in real-time.
marketing.screenshotDesc: Automatically share raid summaries and track live map events directly in your Discord server.
marketing.feature1Desc: Every raid you log on ArcTracker is automatically posted to your Discord channel with loot details and value.
marketing.feature2Desc: Track active and upcoming map events like Night Raid, Cold Snap, and Matriarch spawns in real-time.
marketing.highlight1: Free to use for all servers
marketing.linkSectionDesc: Generate a code, then use /addraider with your code or give it to your server owner.
marketing.ctaText: Ready to level up your Discord server?

commands.title: Slash Commands
commands.subtitle: Everything you need to set up and manage the bot in your server.
commands.addraiderPurpose: Link a user to receive their raid reports
commands.removeraiderPurpose: Stop posting a user's raid reports
commands.listraidersPurpose: View all linked users in your server
commands.setupDesc: Launch the interactive setup wizard to configure the bot for your server. The wizard will guide you through setting up the events channel for live map timers and the raids channel for automatic raid reports. This is the easiest way to get started.
commands.languageDesc: Change the display language for event boards and raid reports. Supports all languages available on ArcTracker.
commands.addraiderDesc: Link an ArcTracker user to your server. Once linked, whenever that user completes a raid on ArcTracker, a summary will automatically be posted to your raids channel. Get link codes from the section below.
commands.removeraiderDesc: Remove a linked user from your server. Their raid reports will no longer be posted. Use /listraiders to see exact usernames and IDs.
commands.listraidersDesc: View all ArcTracker users currently linked to your server. Shows each user's display name, ArcTracker ID, and who added them.

adminGuide.title: Server Admin Guide
adminGuide.permissionsDesc: You can restrict who can use bot commands by configuring permissions in Discord's Server Settings.
adminGuide.step1: Right-click the ArcTracker bot in your server
adminGuide.step3: Configure which roles or channels can use each command
adminGuide.tipContent: Most commands require "Manage Server" permission by default. Only /addraider can be used by anyone, allowing members to link their own accounts.

AppsPage.overlayDescription: Access ARCTracker directly in-game. Inspect items, view interactive maps, and track your progress without leaving the game.
AppsPage.discordBotDescription: Add the ARCTracker bot to your Discord server for automatic raid reports and live map event timers.

TermsPage.title: Terms of Service
TermsPage.introSection:
Please read these Terms of Service ("Terms", "Terms of Service") carefully before using the ArcTracker.io website (the "Service") operated by ArcTracker.io ("us", "we", or "our").

Your access to and use of the Service is conditioned upon your acceptance of and compliance with these Terms. These Terms apply to all visitors, users, and others who wish to access or use the Service.

By accessing or using the Service you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you disagree with any part of the terms then you do not have permission to access the Service.
TermsPage.intellectualPropertyContent:
The Service and its original content, features, and functionality are and will remain the exclusive property of ArcTracker.io and its licensors. The Service is protected by copyright, trademark, and other laws of both the United States and foreign countries. Our trademarks and trade dress may not be used in connection with any product or service without the prior written consent of ArcTracker.io.

Game content and materials depicted are trademarks and copyrights of Embark Studios AB and its licensors. All rights reserved. This Service is not affiliated with Embark Studios AB.
TermsPage.linksContent:
Our Service may contain links to third-party web sites or services that are not owned or controlled by ArcTracker.io.

ArcTracker.io has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party web sites or services. We do not warrant the offerings of any of these entities/individuals or their websites.
TermsPage.contactContent: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us: matt@arctracker.io

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.introSection:
ArcTracker.io ("us", "we", or "our") operates the ArcTracker.io website (the "Service"). This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.

We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.
PrivacyPage.infoCollectionContent: We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you.
PrivacyPage.usageDataContent:
We may collect information on how the Service is accessed and used ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g., IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers, and other diagnostic data.

We use Google Analytics to collect this Usage Data. Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google that tracks and reports website traffic. Google uses the data collected to track and monitor the use of our Service. This data is shared with other Google services. Google may use the collected data to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network.

For more information on the privacy practices of Google, please visit the Google Privacy & Terms web page: https://policies.google.com/privacy

You can opt-out of having made your activity on the Service available to Google Analytics by installing the Google Analytics opt-out browser add-on. The add-on prevents the Google Analytics JavaScript (ga.js, analytics.js, and dc.js) from sharing information with Google Analytics about visits activity.
PrivacyPage.adDataContent:
We use NitroPay (NitroAds) to serve advertisements on our Service. NitroPay may collect information about your visits to our website and other websites to provide targeted advertisements. This may include information such as your IP address, browser type, device identifiers, pages visited, and interaction with advertisements.

NitroPay may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect this information. The information collected is used to serve relevant advertisements and measure advertising effectiveness. This data may be shared with advertisers and other third parties.

For more information about NitroPay's privacy practices, please visit: https://nitropay.com/privacy
PrivacyPage.cookiesContent:
We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and hold certain information. Cookies are files with small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device.

You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service. Google Analytics and NitroPay also use cookies as part of their services.
PrivacyPage.useOfDataContent:
ArcTracker.io uses the collected data for various purposes:

• To provide and maintain our Service
• To notify you about changes to our Service
• To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so
• To provide customer support
• To gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service
• To monitor the usage of our Service
• To detect, prevent and address technical issues
• To serve targeted advertisements and measure their effectiveness
PrivacyPage.ccpaContent:
If you are a California resident, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) provides you with specific rights regarding your personal information.

California residents have the right to:

• Right to Know: Request disclosure of the categories and specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you, the categories of sources from which we collected it, the business purpose for collecting it, and the categories of third parties with whom we shared it.

• Right to Delete: Request deletion of your personal information that we have collected, subject to certain exceptions.

• Right to Opt-Out: Opt-out of the sale of your personal information.

• Right to Non-Discrimination: Not be discriminated against for exercising any of your CCPA rights.

We collect the following categories of personal information:
• Internet or other electronic network activity information (browsing history, interactions with our website)
• Device identifiers (IP address, browser type, device type)
• Geolocation data (approximate location based on IP address)

We may share your personal information with third-party advertising partners. Under CCPA, this may be considered a "sale" of personal information. You have the right to opt-out of this sale.

To exercise your rights under CCPA, please contact us at matt@arctracker.io. We will verify your identity before processing your request and respond within 45 days.
PrivacyPage.consentContent: You can manage your advertising and tracking consent preferences at any time by clicking the link below.
PrivacyPage.contactContent: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us: matt@arctracker.io

ScammerCheckPage.title: Trader Verification
ScammerCheckPage.subtitle: Check Before You Trade
ScammerCheckPage.description: Verify if an ARC Raiders player is a trusted trader or has been reported as a scammer by the community.
ScammerCheckPage.invalidFormat: Invalid format. Please use the Name#1234 format (e.g., Player#1234).
ScammerCheckPage.notFound: No data found for this user.
ScammerCheckPage.enterUsername: Enter a player ID to check
ScammerCheckPage.enterUsernameHint: Paste the player's in-game ID to see if they're verified or have any scammer reports.
ScammerCheckPage.howToGetId: How to get a player's ID
ScammerCheckPage.howToGetIdStep1: Right-click on the player's name in-game
ScammerCheckPage.howToGetIdStep3: Paste it in the search box above
ScammerCheckPage.verifiedExplanation: Verified traders have linked their ARC Raiders account to ARCTracker, proving they own their in-game identity. This adds a layer of trust when trading.
ScammerCheckPage.notVerifiedExplanation: This player hasn't verified their account. This doesn't mean they're a scammer, just that their identity hasn't been confirmed.
ScammerCheckPage.becomeVerifiedDescription: Build trust in the trading community by verifying your ARC Raiders account. It's free and takes less than a minute.
ScammerCheckPage.becomeVerifiedBenefit1: Prove you own your in-game identity
ScammerCheckPage.becomeVerifiedBenefit2: Build trust with potential trading partners
ScammerCheckPage.becomeVerifiedBenefit3: Help make trading safer for everyone
ScammerCheckPage.extensionDescription: Our official Chrome extension securely links your ARC Raiders account to ARCTracker, verifying that you own your in-game name.
ScammerCheckPage.tradingSafetyTip1: Always check a trader's verification status before trading
ScammerCheckPage.tradingSafetyTip2: Use a trusted middleman for high-value trades
ScammerCheckPage.tradingSafetyTip3: Record a video of your trade to use as evidence if something goes wrong
ScammerCheckPage.tradingSafetyTip4: Report scammers to help protect the community
ScammerCheckPage.lookingToTradeDescription: Join the ARC Raiders LFG Discord to find trusted trading partners, use verified middlemen, and connect with the trading community.

RaidHistoryPage.betaTooltip: This feature is in beta and may change over time. Please bear with us if there are any issues with item identification.
RaidHistoryPage.addRaidDescription: Log a new raid with items extracted and outcome.
RaidHistoryPage.editRaidDescription: Update the details of this raid.
RaidHistoryPage.firStatusOff: Not Found in Raid (click to toggle)

RaidHistoryPage.noRaidsWithFilters: No raids match your current filters.
RaidHistoryPage.noRaidsYet: Start tracking your raids to see them here.
RaidHistoryPage.shareRaidDescription: Make this raid public to share with others.
RaidHistoryPage.publicRaidDesc: Anyone with the link can view this raid.
RaidHistoryPage.privateRaidDesc: Only you can view this raid.
RaidHistoryPage.deleteRaidDescription: This action cannot be undone. The raid and all its data will be permanently deleted.

RaidHistoryPage.noItemsRecorded: No items were recorded for this raid.
RaidHistoryPage.canSaveAndReturn: You can save now and come back later if you don't want to wait.

RaidHistoryPage.screenshotHint: Upload your end-of-raid screen to auto-detect items
RaidHistoryPage.screenshotNoCrop: Must be a full screenshot. Do not crop.
RaidHistoryPage.itemsEmptyHint: Add items manually or upload a screenshot above to auto-detect
RaidHistoryPage.screenshotInvalidType: Please upload a JPEG, PNG, or WebP image
RaidHistoryPage.screenshotTooLarge: Image is too large. Maximum size is 5MB
RaidHistoryPage.mergeItemsDescription: Your screenshot has been analyzed. How would you like to handle the detected items?
RaidHistoryPage.replaceItemsHint: Keep only detected items ({unique} unique, {total} total)
RaidHistoryPage.visionDetected: Detected {count, plural, one {# item} other {# items}}
RaidHistoryPage.verifyItemInstruction: Please verify this item matches the screenshot. Select the correct item or search for a different one.
RaidHistoryPage.itemsNeedReview: {count} {count, plural, one {item needs} other {items need}} review
RaidHistoryPage.profilePublicDesc: Anyone with your profile link can view your public raids.
RaidHistoryPage.profilePrivateDesc: Your raid history is private. Enable sharing to get a public profile link.
RaidHistoryPage.noPublicRaidsDescription: This user hasn't shared any raids publicly yet.

tutorial.step1Description: Click here to log a raid! Upload a screenshot from the "Returning to Speranza" screen and our AI will automatically extract your loot items.
tutorial.step2Description: Choose which map you played on, and optionally select any active events during your raid.
tutorial.step3Description: Upload your end-of-raid screenshot here. Our AI will detect and extract all the items you brought back. You can also add items manually if needed.

marketing.heroSubtitle: Automatically track every raid, analyze your earnings, and sync your found items to quests and hideout upgrades with our custom AI-powered screenshot analysis.
marketing.feature1Desc: Upload your end-of-raid screenshot and our custom AI instantly detects all extracted items.
marketing.feature2Desc: Automatically apply raid loot to your quest and hideout requirements. No more manual tracking.
marketing.feature3Desc: Track your income, survival rate, and raid performance over time with visual dashboards.
marketing.feature4Desc: Generate public links to share your best (or worst) raids with the community. Link your account with our Discord Bot to have your raids automatically shared in your server.
marketing.highlight1: Supports all maps and seasonal events
marketing.highlight3: Undo sync if you make a mistake
marketing.ctaText: Start tracking your raids today. It's free!
marketing.screenshotDashboardDesc: View comprehensive stats, filter by map/season, and analyze your raid performance over time.

RaidSync.title: Apply to Progress
RaidSync.description: Apply items from this raid to your needed items tracker. Drag to reorder priority.
RaidSync.noMatchingItems: No items from this raid match your current needs.
RaidSync.blueprintsFound: {count, plural, one {# blueprint found} other {# blueprints found}}
RaidSync.applySuccessDescription: Added {items} items. {requirements} requirements complete. {blueprints, plural, =0 {} one {# blueprint learned.} other {# blueprints learned.}}
RaidSync.applySuccessItems: {count, plural, one {# item added} other {# items added}}
RaidSync.applySuccessRequirements: {count, plural, one {# requirement complete} other {# requirements complete}}
RaidSync.applySuccessBlueprints: {count, plural, one {# blueprint learned} other {# blueprints learned}}
RaidSync.undoSuccessDescription: Removed {items} items from your tracker. {blueprints, plural, =0 {} one {# blueprint unlearned.} other {# blueprints unlearned.}}

tutorial.step1Description: Items you found in this raid can be applied to your Needed Items tracker. This helps you track progress toward hideout upgrades, quests, and projects.
tutorial.step2Description: If an item is needed for multiple things, drag to reorder which requirement gets filled first. Higher items receive items before lower ones.
tutorial.step3Description: Made a mistake? No worries! You can undo applied progress anytime from the raid card using the "Undo" button.

SeasonHistoryPage.title: Season History
SeasonHistoryPage.noHistoryDescription: You haven't completed any season wipes yet. Complete the End of Season wizard to save your progress.
SeasonHistoryPage.earnedForNextSeason: Skill Points earned for next season

wizard.whatHappens: What happens when you complete the wizard:

step1.title: End of Season 1
step1.description: Season 1 is ending! Complete this wizard to save your progress snapshot and prepare for Season 2.
step1.bonusPoints: Earn bonus skill points based on your stash credits (1 point per 1M credits, up to 5)
step1.snapshot: Your current progress will be saved to your season history
step1.reset: Your quest, hideout, and skill progress will be reset for Season 2

step2.title: Enter Your Season Progress
step2.description: Enter your current stash credit value and player level from ARC Raiders.
step2.creditsHelp: You can find this value in your ARC Raiders Expedition screen.
step2.levelHelp: Your current player level in ARC Raiders (1-75).
step2.bonusPointsInfo: You earn 1 bonus skill point for every {perMillion} credits (max 5 points)

step3.title: Confirm Season Reset
step3.description: This action cannot be undone. Please review the summary below before confirming.

step4.title: Season 1 Complete!
step4.description: Your progress has been saved and your tracker has been reset for Season 2.
step4.descriptionAlreadyDone: You've already completed the Season 1 wipe. Here's your saved progress.

SquadsPage.signInRequired: Sign in to view your squads
SquadsPage.signInDescription: Create or join squads to share raid history and needed items with your team.

SquadsPage.shareNeededItemsDescription: Allow squad members to see items you need

marketing.heroSubtitle: Create private groups to share raid history, map pins, and coordinate loot routes with your trusted teammates.
marketing.screenshotAlt: Squad page showing shared raid history
marketing.screenshotDescription: View combined raid history, share private map pins, and coordinate with your squad.
marketing.featureRaidHistoryDesc: Share your raid history with squadmates. See combined loot and track team performance together.
marketing.featureMapPinsDesc: Share secret loot routes and valuable locations only with your trusted squad members.
marketing.featureNeededItemsDesc: Coordinate item needs across the squad. Know what teammates are looking for.
marketing.featureTeamDesc: Up to 10 members per squad free, or unlimited members with Premium subscription.
marketing.ctaText: Start coordinating with your squad today!

StashPage.title: Stash
StashPage.signInDescription: Sign in to access your stash and link your ARC Raiders account.
StashPage.extensionRequiredDescription: The ARCTracker Chrome extension is required to link your ARC Raiders account. The extension helps redirect the OAuth flow back to ARCTracker.
StashPage.installExtensionFirst: Install the browser extension to enable account linking.
StashPage.unsupportedBrowser: You need to be using Chrome or Firefox to install the extension.
StashPage.linkDescription: Connect your ARC Raiders account to enable stash synchronization. Choose your login provider below.
StashPage.linkBannerDescription: Link your ARC Raiders account to sync your hideout progress, completed quests, and more directly from your game data.
StashPage.tokenExpiredDescription: Your session has expired. Please refresh the connection to continue syncing.
StashPage.unlinkDialogDescription: This will remove the connection to your ARC Raiders account. You can link it again at any time.
StashPage.unlinkError: Failed to unlink ARC Raiders account. Please try again.
StashPage.comingSoonDescription: Once linked, you'll be able to view and manage your in-game stash inventory here.

StashPage.consentAccessProgress: Your hideout levels and quest completion

loadout.title: Loadout
loadout.syncToSee: Sync your inventory to see your loadout

settings.stashSourceOfTruthDescription: When enabled, items in your synced stash will automatically count toward quest, hideout, and project requirements.

StashPage.betaTooltip: This feature is in beta. Some items may appear as unknown or mismatched. Right-click items to suggest corrections.

tutorial.step1Description: Use these buttons to sync your Hideout, Quest, and Project progress directly from your ARC Raiders account.
tutorial.step2Description: Toggle this on to automatically count items in your stash toward quest, hideout, and project requirements — no manual tracking needed!
tutorial.step3Description: This feature is in beta — some items may show as unknown or mismatched. Right-click items to suggest what they should be. The default sort is "Unsorted" to match the in-game view, so you can compare and identify any issues.

marketing.heroSubtitle: Link your ARC Raiders account to automatically sync your inventory, track needed items, and view your loadout — all in one place.
marketing.feature1Desc: Import your hideout levels, quest completion, and project progress directly from your ARC Raiders account.
marketing.feature2Desc: Toggle stash tracking to automatically count items toward quest, hideout, and project requirements.
marketing.feature3Desc: See your current in-game loadout including weapons, shields, backpack, and quick-use items at a glance.
marketing.feature4Title: Safe to Sell at a Glance
marketing.feature4Desc: Icons on each item show whether it's needed for progression or safe to sell and recycle — no guesswork required.
marketing.screenshotCaption: Your complete stash inventory synced from ARC Raiders.
marketing.ctaText: Sign in and link your account to start syncing your stash.

DevelopersPage.title: Developer Apps
DevelopersPage.emptyDescription: Register your first app to get an API key and start building.
DevelopersPage.registerAppDescription: Tell us about your application. Apps are activated immediately with 500 requests/hour.
DevelopersPage.dataUsagePlaceholder: How will you use the data?

AppDetailPage.requestUpgradeDescription: Need more than your current rate limit? Tell us why and we'll review your request.
AppDetailPage.upgradeReasonPlaceholder: Explain why you need a higher rate limit...
AppDetailPage.upgradePending: Rate limit upgrade request is pending review.
AppDetailPage.rotateKeyDescription: This will invalidate your current API key and generate a new one. Any applications using the old key will stop working.
AppDetailPage.deleteAppDescription: This will permanently delete this application and revoke its API key. This action cannot be undone.

ApiDocsPage.title: API Documentation
ApiDocsPage.gettingStartedDescription: The ArcTracker API provides access to ARC Raiders game data. Public endpoints require no authentication, while user data endpoints use a dual-key authentication system.
ApiDocsPage.gettingStartedStep1: 1. Public endpoints (items, quests, hideout, projects) are freely accessible with no authentication.
ApiDocsPage.gettingStartedStep2: 2. To access user data, register an app at the Developer Dashboard to get an app key.
ApiDocsPage.gettingStartedStep3: 3. Users create personal API keys in their Settings page and share them with your app.
ApiDocsPage.publicEndpointsDescription: These endpoints return static game data and require no authentication. Responses include all locales as multilingual objects (e.g., name: { en: "...", de: "...", ... }). Responses are cached and suitable for high-frequency requests.
ApiDocsPage.endpointItems: All items with multilingual names, descriptions, and effects. Static response, no parameters.
ApiDocsPage.endpointQuests: All quests with multilingual details, objectives, and rewards. Static response, no parameters.
ApiDocsPage.endpointHideout: All hideout modules with multilingual names, levels, and requirements. Static response, no parameters.
ApiDocsPage.endpointProjects: All projects with multilingual names and phases. Supports season filtering.
ApiDocsPage.paramLocale: Language code (e.g., en, de, fr). Defaults to en.
ApiDocsPage.authenticationDescription: User data endpoints use a dual-key system. Your app sends both an app key and a user key with each request. This ensures users explicitly consent to sharing their data.
ApiDocsPage.authStep1Description: Go to the Developer Dashboard and register your app. You'll receive an app key (arc_k1_...) that identifies your application.
ApiDocsPage.authStep2Description: Users go to Settings > Developer Access and create a personal API key (arc_u1_...) with the scopes they want to share.
ApiDocsPage.authStep3Description: Include the app key in the X-App-Key header and the user key in the Authorization: Bearer header.
ApiDocsPage.headerAppKey: Your app's API key (from Developer Dashboard)
ApiDocsPage.authenticatedEndpointsDescription: These endpoints return user-specific data and require both an app key and a user key.
ApiDocsPage.endpointProfile: Basic user profile information (username, level, member since).
ApiDocsPage.endpointStash: User's inventory/stash with enriched item data. Supports pagination.
ApiDocsPage.endpointLoadout: User's current loadout with enriched equipment details.
ApiDocsPage.endpointUserQuests: User's quest completion progress with optional filtering.
ApiDocsPage.rateLimitsDescription: Each app gets 500 requests per hour by default. Rate limit info is included in response headers. You can request a higher limit from the Developer Dashboard.
ApiDocsPage.rateLimitResetHeader: Unix timestamp when the rate limit resets.
ApiDocsPage.errorCodesDescription: All error responses follow a standard format with an error code and message.
ApiDocsPage.error401: Missing or invalid API key(s). Check both app key and user key.
ApiDocsPage.error403: Insufficient scope or app suspended. The user key must include the required scope.
ApiDocsPage.error404: Resource not found or user has no data for this endpoint.
ApiDocsPage.error429: Rate limit exceeded. Wait for the reset time in the X-RateLimit-Reset header.
ApiDocsPage.error500: Internal server error. Please try again later.
ApiDocsPage.responseFormatDescription: All authenticated endpoints return a consistent JSON envelope.
